questions.question: Which of these options is correct in listing the four ages of man

choices.answer: Stone Age, Ancient Times, Middle Ages, Modern Age
Pre-history, Ancient Times, Dark Ages, Modern Age
Stone Age, Ancient Times, Medieval Times, Renaissance, Modern Age
Pre-history, Ancient Times, Middle Ages, Modern Age

questions.question: Which is the correct definition for the term BCE?

choices.answer: Before Christ Existed
Before Common Era
Before the Christian Empire
Before the Crusades Eventuated

questions.question: Which is the correct definition for CE?

choices.answer: Common Error
Common Erra
Common Era
Comon Era
10 years
1,000 years
100 years
Creation of writing
The Bronze Age
The invention of printing
Invention of farming
The end of Ancient Egypt
The building of the Great Wall of China
The fall (end) of the Roman Empire in Rome
The beginning of the Dark Ages in Britain

questions.question: Which of the following are all examples of primary sources for the study of Ancient Greece?

choices.answer: The Parthenon, Percy Jackson and the Olympians movie and legend of Hercules
Actual ancient temple ruins, Athens Museum and the modern Olympics
The movies of Troy, starring Brad Pitt, and The 300 and Athens Museum
The Parthenon, the legend of Hercules and the ruins of Sparta

questions.question: Which of the following are all examples of secondary sources of the World Wars:

choices.answer: A modern textbook, wikipedia and YouTube?
The movie Gallipoli, the Diary of Anne Frank and an actual WWI aircraft?
A modern textbook, a relic from WWI and the movie Gallipoli?
Wikipedia, the movie Pearl Harbour and a WWII medal?

questions.question: The Historical Concept of Evidence is best defined as:

choices.answer: The ability to understand anotherâ€™s point of view or decision-making.
The importance that is assigned to particular aspects of the past.
Information obtained from sources that could be either primary or secondary
The link between what causes an action and the outcome of that action.

questions.question: The best response for what the Dark Ages were is:

choices.answer: The time before the creation of writing, with little learning or progress.
The period of time after the fall of Rome and the end of the Ancient Times.
The time of the Black Death.
The time of the Nazis in WWII.

questions.question: The feudal system was based on:

choices.answer: Devotion to the Catholic Church
Loyalty to the king
Rights and obligations based around land ownership
Whoever could provide security.

questions.question: In feudal Europe most people lived in or on:

choices.answer: Working the land in large areas called manors
Trade and industry based in the capital cities
Castles working for their lord
Working for the Church

questions.question: In return for land and protection, feudal peasants had to:

choices.answer: Offer their first born to their lord
Pay taxes or produce, fight and work for their lord
Only work for their lord, no one else
Give their lord their whole crop or harvest.

questions.question: Why was life expectancy so much shorter in the Medieval period?

choices.answer: War, famine and disease
War, obesity and cancer
Plague, Alzheimer's and diabetes
Famine, plague and obesity

questions.question: Which of the following were tribes who helped destroy the Roman Empire:

choices.answer: The Vikings, Mongols and Goths
The Vandals, the Huns and Visigoths
The Vikings, Vandals and Vichysoire
The Vandals, Carthagians and Mongols
